text: I have used Chain.jl for the fist time on SO :smile: (CC <@UK1BNFHFV>): <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65789320/how-to-reshape-group-by-and-rename-julia-dataframe/65790242#65790242>

attachments.title: How to reshape, group by and rename Julia dataframe?
attachments.text: I have the following DataFrame : Police Product PV1 PV2 PV3 PM1 PM2 PM3 0 1 AA 10 8 14 150 145 140 1 2 AB 25 4 7 700 650 620 2 3 ...
attachments.fallback: Stack Overflow: How to reshape, group by and rename Julia dataframe?

elements.text: I have used Chain.jl for the fist time on SO

text: It really pleases me visually that there are no |> operators. I always thought the .method() way of python etc was nice for chaining but then again you are limited to a predefined set of functions. And %>% in R I find really really ugly :man-shrugging:

elements.text: It really pleases me visually that there are no |> operators. I always thought the .method() way of python etc was nice for chaining but then again you are limited to a predefined set of functions. And %>% in R I find really really ugly

text: Hey look it’s the author of chain.jl!
